svg.text: Week in Ethereum News - August 8 2021

title: "Week in Ethereum News
August 8, 2021" date: "2021-08-08"
Eth News and Links
Mainnet execution layer - London fork happened and 1559 is live!
• Latest core devs call video. Notes from Tim Beiko ; shortest call ever assessing the smooth success
(so far!) of the London upgrade
• 1559 monitoring and ETH burning dashboards: Etherchain Burn , Watch the Burn , Ultrasound Money ,
Python script to show boxplots from your node, Otterscan (uses your Erigon node). After 3 days, over
15k ETH burned
• After 3 days, over 15k ETH burned
• An 1559 fee estimator for the next block
• On the first day, 1559 led to negative issuance for half an hour
• Wallets beginning to support 1559 transactions, eg MetaMask extension starts this week. There was a
last minute wallet UX issue leading to web3js and Infura hotfix releases pre-London
• 1559 doesn’t reduce gas fees, here’s some things to keep in mind during transition
• Ansgar: how 1559 reduces MEV and gives it to the protocol by bifurcating the inclusion and ordering
markets for transactions
• Some debate in the address extension space research area
EIPs/Standards
• EIP3709 : deprecate transaction type 1
Proof of stake consensus layer
• A model for cumulative committee-based finality , a possible alternative to CBC in the future
• What’s coming in prysm v2 for stakers ; breaking changes for Altair fork
• Dafny , official release of formally verified spec of Eth staking
• ethmodel.io : cadCAD’s simulator of total ETH supply and staking yield
Layer2
• Arbitrum to launch this month in a few weeks with some safety rails
• NXTP for crosschain transfers and contract calls from Connext. Onchain data model only, uses
subgraphs
This newsletter is made possible thanks to Kwenta by Synthetix !
Kwenta enables traders to access real-world and derivative assets on-chain using the power of the
Synthetix protocol.
Long or short popular synthetic cryptocurrencies, commodities, forex, and equities without the limits
or compromises of a centralized exchange.
You can now also use L2 Kwenta on Optimism for low gas fees and blazing fast transactions!
Stuff for developers
• web3js v1.5.1 - should update for 1559
• web3J adds 1559 support for Java devs
• Nethereum v4.0.2 supports Eth_FeeHistory for v1.10.6 until next Geth release
• Switch to WalletConnect v1.5.2 ASAP
• UseDapp - browser extension to give you developer tools network tab in web3 frontends
• Hardhat packager plugin to prepare artifacts and TypeChain bindings for registry deployment
• How to fork mainnet with Hardhat step by step
• Reorgme : create reorgs on private chains
• sol2uml now supports file-level structs and enums which Solidity introduced in 0.6.x
• abi-to-sol v0.5 accepts custom errors in input ABIs and corresponding outputs
• Login with Eth quickstart for devs
• build an AssemblyScript chain on TheGraph , Dennison Bertram PoC
• If Santi Palladino was writing his Eth for web devs book now…
Security
• Popsicle Finance hacked for ~$25m via new depositors allowed to withdraw rewards from deployment;
same bug as WildCredit
• Ashiq Amien finds access control bug in Alchemix
• Fake partnership via Andre Cronje deepfake video call ?
• Using a honeypot to investigate Twitter reply scams
• Want to be an auditor? Secureum bootcamp is extending the application deadline (it’s free!)
Ecosystem
• Eth scalability roadmap from a user’s POV
• Bot on bot MEV violence: tx.origin arb bot executes attacker’s arbitrary call . Now made ~$1m
• Videos from yesterday’s reorg.wtf online summit
• Rabby browser extension (open source, forks at least some of MetaMask, caveat emptor)
• Ethereum miner revenue higher than Bitcoin for the 3rd consecutive month
Enterprise
• GoQuorum v21.7.0 - new consensus engine for the QBFT algorithm.
• Hyperledger Besu v21.7.2 - some hotfixes for London
Application layer - all the focus on London
• Louis Vitton launches “ Louis the Game ” with NFTs on Ethereum
• Oiler Network has an alpha on mainnet (with fake USDC) for 1559-enabled gas hedging
• A simple bill splitting app
• More Real World Assets for Maker : Matthew Rabinowitz starts Delaware trust for corporate office
leases
• You can get ~7% fixed APR on USDC at Element (disclosure: Evan is an advisor; of course there’s code
risk, but that’s a solid fixed rate)
Regulation/business/tokens
• US Senate drama: Yellen’s Treasury Dept glommed crypto regulations onto Biden’s trillion dollar
infrastructure bill; Wyden (D-OR), Lummis (R-WY), Toomey (R-PA) amendment to make the anti-crypto
regulations less bad, but Warner (D-VA), Portman (R-OH) and Sinema (D-AZ) create special carve out for
PoW (and later other favored tech). Biden pushed Warner's special carve out for PoW miners. Votes are
supposed to be today, follow Jake Chervinsky on Twitter for updates. Currently it appears leadership
is pressuring for a compromise Ryan Selkis compiled some undecided Senators : Lujan (D-NM), Collins
(R-ME), Merkley (D-OR), Cantwell (D-WA), Bennett (D-CO), Manchin (D-WV), Markey (D-MA), Van Hollen
(D-MD), Cortez Masto (D-NV), Rosen (D-NV), Gillibrand (D-NY), Cassidy (R-LA), Romney (R-UT),
Hickenlooper (D-CO), Kelly (D-CO), Tuberville (R-AL), Hagerty (R-TN), Ossoff (D-GA)
• Votes are supposed to be today, follow Jake Chervinsky on Twitter for updates. Currently it appears
leadership is pressuring for a compromise
• Ryan Selkis compiled some undecided Senators : Lujan (D-NM), Collins (R-ME), Merkley (D-OR),
Cantwell (D-WA), Bennett (D-CO), Manchin (D-WV), Markey (D-MA), Van Hollen (D-MD), Cortez Masto
(D-NV), Rosen (D-NV), Gillibrand (D-NY), Cassidy (R-LA), Romney (R-UT), Hickenlooper (D-CO), Kelly
(D-CO), Tuberville (R-AL), Hagerty (R-TN), Ossoff (D-GA)
• You can’t be tough on BigTech while trying to kill off alternatives to it
• SEC settles with DMM to disgorge profits from token sale and pay $125k individual fines
• JP Koning: stablecoins are regulated
• Justin Drake’s updated model for Eth supply and sell pressure reduction
• Vineyard Holdings: a DCF valuation model for Eth
• Nikhil Shamapant: 1559 and the triple halving thesis
General/crypto
• Facebook opensources Winterfell STARK prover/verifier
• If you’re doing a trusted SNARK setup, try this easy to use UI
• Online courses on Probabilistically Checkable Proofs and Interactive Proofs by Ale Chiesa and Tom
Gur
• Blind signatures over elliptic curves explainer
• Apple inserts backdoor to scan your phone in violation of their privacy promise
• Google employees regularly browse your data
• Pplpleaser profile in Fortune
Job Listings
• Founding auditor at Yearn's yAcademy , $10,000 referral reward if hired
• Solidity is hiring a C++ dev
• WalletConnect looking for Javascript/Typescript devs
• Rotki tracking and tax app hiring Python backend dev & Vue/Typescript dev
• Ethereum Foundation: Test Engineer for consensus and execution layers
• Nethermind internship program
Want to reach people experienced with Ethereum? List your job here. $345 per line (~75 character limit
including spaces), payable in ETH (or 345 DAI or 345 USDC) to abcoathup.eth. Questions? abcoathup
at-gmail
Follow @WeekinEthNews to find out what the most clicked links are. Follow @evan_van_ness and
@abcoathup to get most of the week’s news in real time.
Permalink for this week’s issue: https://weekinethereumnews.com/week-in-ethereum-news-august-8-2021/
Dates of Note
Upcoming dates of note (new/changes in bold ) :
• Aug 12 - applications close for EF small grants for events
• Aug 13 - Sign in with Ethereum RFP extended deadline
• Aug 13 - Post-London assessment wallet/infra call
• Aug 17 - applications close for written pieces on public goods projects
• Aug 27-29 - Edcon (Shenzhen/online)
• Oct 1-3 - EthAtlanta enterprise-focused hackathon & keynotes
• Oct 22-24 - ETH Lisbon
Did you get forwarded this newsletter? Sign up to receive it weekly
